imdb.title: Ushinawareta Mirai wo Motomete
imdb.plot: An astronomy club gets caught up in a bizarre series of events at an old school building while trying to unravel the circumstances revolving around the sudden appearance of a mysterious transfer student named Yui.

episodes.title: The Lost Future
episodes.plot: Sou is an ordinary high school student. His biggest worries are his Astronomy Club's project, the zany antics of his fellow club members, and his childhood friend who's suddenly not her usual cheerful self, but then, things take a strange turn.

episodes.title: Proving the Existence of Her and the Ghost
episodes.plot: After Yui's sudden and mysterious appearance, the Astronomy Club gang tries to make her feel welcome as she struggles to figure out what she is doing at Uchihama Academy.

episodes.title: The President Dreams with Sparkling Eyes
episodes.plot: Airi reminisces about how she met Kaori and Sou. The Astronomy Club once again takes on the Judo and Karate Club dispute, with a slightly different outcome. And they also make headway on the case of the school ghost.

episodes.title: All Things Are in a State of Flux
episodes.plot: Sou enjoys getting to know his new camera and to give Sou more quality time with it, the Astronomy Club uses the fine weather as an excuse to skip classes to go for a picnic, but things go slightly awry when they miss their bus stop.

episodes.title: The Way of the Quantum Cat and the Droplet
episodes.plot: The kids yawn through a lecture on quantum theory and Schrödinger's cat and after classes, the Astronomy Club gets to the bottom of the oddly low-tech school festival project of the Computer Club.

episodes.title: Career Counseling for a Bird in a Cage
episodes.plot: The Astronomy Club members discuss the career paths everyone plans to take after high school, but Sou finds out that Nagisa's path is further complicated by an arranged marriage looming over her head.

episodes.title: Waiting 2.39 Million Light-Years
episodes.plot: The Astronomy Club preps for the school festival, half of them working on the planetarium and half of them working on the café side of things and Yui's apparent concern for Kaori leads her to do some odd things.

episodes.title: Shooting Stars Passing in the Night
episodes.plot: As the fateful day of Kaori's accident approaches once more, everything plays out slightly differently due to Yui's presence.

episodes.title: Gateway to the Past
episodes.plot: Kaori's poor prognosis of recovery from the accident leaves everyone reeling and desperate to find some way to save her.

episodes.title: The Time Remaining
episodes.plot: Yui returns to her "save point" once more and she recalls all the things she has tried before, each time hoping for a different outcome.

episodes.title: I'll See You Again Tomorrow, Right?
episodes.plot: Things are going quite a bit more differently in this time line as Sou's interest in Yui seems stronger than usual. But even as the outcome remains uncertain, Yui ponders what the consequences will be if she succeed.

episodes.title: The Future That Has You
episodes.plot: Yui succeeds in keeping Kaori away from the accident and disappears, almost as though she never existed, but the other members of the Astronomy Club are left with a nagging feeling that they are missing something.

episodes.title: OVA: In Search of the Lost Summer Vacation
episodes.plot: Thirteenth episode delivered as a bonus Blu-Ray disc to customers who preordered all six Blu-Ray volumes.
